description: Installation of temporary structures for 5 years comprising an indoor leisure and recreation facility (Class E(d)) and an exhibition hall (Class F1(e)), provision of a temporary structure for use as a cafe (Class E(b)) alongside a temporary sub-station and use of the existing shipping containers as toilet and changing facilities and a cafe (Class E(b)) in association with the indoor leisure and recreation facility (Class E(d)) as well as other associated and enabling works to include external landscaping, lighting, fencing, servicing and access arrangements.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - This permission is for a limited period of 5 years expiring on [the date of completion of the legal agreement + 5 years] and the structures and associated landscaping hereby permitted must be removed (and the land restored to its former condition) by or before [the date of completion of the legal agreement + 5 years].
Reason: The siting and design of the development is unsuitable for retention on a permanent basis; and to, to comply with Section 72 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.
Condition : 2 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the reports, specifications and drawings detailed [60325700-00-01 01, 60325700-00-111 01, 60325700-00-115 01, 60325700-00-115 01, 60325700-00-32 02, 60325700-00-33 01, 60325700-00-37 01, 60325700-00-38 02, 60325700-00-40 01, 60325700-00-41 02, 60325700-00-52 01, 60325700-00-51 02, 0187-KLA-00-01-DR-10 000 P01, 0187-KLA-00-01-DR-10 001 P01, 0187-KLA-00-01-DR-10 002 P01, 0187-KLA-00-01-DR-20 001 P01, 0187-KLA-00-01-DR-20 002 P02, 0187-KLA-00-01-DR-30 001 P01, 100_FP VER 04, 101_FP VER 04, 102_FP VER 04, 103_FP VER 04, 110_FP VER 04, 200_ELE VER 04, 201_ELE VER 05, 202_ELE VER 04, 203_ELE VER 05, 210_SEC VER 04, 211_SEC VER 04, 212_SEC VER 04, 300 DET VER A, 302 DET VER 01, 303 DET VER 01, 80_SP 04, 82_SP 04, 783-CSX-97-ZZ-DR-E-0002.1 P03, 783-CSX-97-ZZ-DR-E-0002.2 P01, 783-CSX-97-ZZ-DR-E-0002.3 P01, 783-CSX-97-ZZ-DR-E-0001.1.1 P03, 783-CSX-97-ZZ-DR-E-0003 P01, 303_DET 01, Un-numbered Concept Detail Facade Clamps.
Design and Access Statement (October 2023) by ARUP
Framework Travel Plan: Phase 6 Meanwhile Use (October 2023) by Markides Associates
Heritage Statement (October 2023) by Mears Architects
Inclusive Design and Accessibility Statement (13 October 2023 Revision P01) by Buro Happold
Plot 1 Lighting Strategy (20/10/2023) by Consolux
Plot 2 Lighting Strategy (18/10/2023) by Consolux
Planning Compliance Report (20/10/2023 27208.PCR.01 Rev B) by KP Acoustics
Sustainability Statement (10 October 2023 Revision P1) by Consolux
Technical Note - Remediation and Verification (17 October 2023) by Plowman Craven
Technical Note - Site Appraisal and Risk Assessment (17 October 2023) by Plowman Craven
Transport Assessment: Phase 6 Meanwhile Uses (September 2023) by Markides Associates
Utilities Statement (18 October 2023 Revision P03) by Buro Happold
Planning Statement, including Statement of Community Involvement (October 2023) by DP9
Plot 2 Sprinkler System Overview (November 2023 Revision P01) by Consolux
Condition : 3 - No water tanks, plant, lift rooms or other permanent structures (unless otherwise shown on the approved plans listed above) shall be erected upon the roof of the approved buildings. 
Reason: To control the appearance of the building and safeguard the appearance of the area, in accordance with Council policies LP1 and LP2 coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.
Condition : 4 - The development permitted by this planning permission shall only be carried out in accordance with the hereby approved Flood Risk Assessment and Drainage Strategy (P03) [by Robert Bird & Partners dated 13th October 2023].
The mitigation measures shall be retained as such.
Reason: To reduce the risk of flooding to the proposed development and future occupants, and third parties in accordance with policy LP12 of the Local Plan coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework.
Condition : 5 - The use of non-road mobile machinery of net power between 37kW and 560kW used in the construction of the development shall meet at least Stage IIIA of the EU Directive 97/68/EC and its amendments. This will apply to both variable and constant speed engines for both NOx and PM.  Prior to works commencing on site, any non-road mobile machinery of net power between 37kW and 560kW to be utilised in the construction of the development shall be registered on the website https://nrmm.london/.
Reason: To help monitor the use of such equipment across London in accordance with the London Plan. It is necessary for the condition to require plant to be registered prior to works starting to ensure all plant is included in the registration.
Condition : 6 - The development shall be built in accordance with the submitted Energy Strategy (Rev P1) [by Consolux dated September 2023] demonstrating how the development will follow the hierarchy of energy efficiency, decentralised energy and renewable energy technologies to secure a minimum 35% reduction in CO2 emissions above the levels set in Building Regulations Part L 2021. 
a)	Prior to first occupation of the Plot 2 development, evidence (e.g. photographs, copies of installation contracts and as-built worksheets prepared under SAP or the National Calculation Method) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority to demonstrate that the development has been carried out in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy. 
The installed measures shall be retained in accordance with the approved details, including the measures for on-going energy monitoring.
Reason: In the interest of sustainable development and to accord with London Plan policy SI2 and Council policy LP10 of the Local Plan 2023 coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework.
Condition : 7 - The development permitted by this planning permission shall only be carried out in accordance with the hereby approved Delivery and Servicing Plan [by Markides Associates dated October 2023]. With all servicing activities to be restricted to between 07:00 to 12:00pm, and in respect of Plot 2 during transition periods, all deliveries shall avoid network peak times of 08:00-10:00 and 16:00-18:00.
Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the neighbourhood and the local highway network, in accordance with Council Policy LP1, LP2 and LP51 and London Plan Policy D3 and T7E.
Condition : 8 - The development permitted by this planning permission shall only be carried out in accordance with the hereby approved Operational Management Plan [by Markides Associated dated October 2023].
-	For Plot 1, the uses hereby permitted shall not be open to customers other than between the hours of 07:00-22:00 (with last entry at 21:00) Monday-Sunday.
-	For Plot 2, the uses hereby permitted shall not be open to customers other than between the hours of 10:00-21:00 (with last entry at 20:00) Monday-Saturday and 10:00-18:00 (with last entry at 17:00) on Sundays.
In accordance with the hereby approved Operational Management Plan, there shall be no sound, speech or music which is audible outside of the Plot 2 building at any time.
Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the neighbourhood, in accordance with Council policy LP1 and LP2 of the Local Plan coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework.
Condition : 9 - Plot 1 court lighting shall be switched off at 22:00 and all other lights shall be switched off at 22:30.
Reason: To preserve residential amenities of the locality and protect the biodiversity of the area in accordance with policies LP1, LP2 and LP55 of the Local Plan coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework.
Condition : 10 - The roller blinds within Plot 1 shall be kept lowered between the hours of 07:00-08:00 and 21:00-22:00.
Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the neighbourhood, in accordance with Council policy LP2 of the Local Plan coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework.
Condition : 11 - The external lighting to the fa�ade of Plot 2 shall be managed in accordance with the hereby approved Operational Management Plan [by Markides Associated dated October 2023]. For the avoidance of doubt, the fa�ade lighting shall only be illuminated between the following times:
-	10:00 - 21:00 Monday to Saturday
-	10:00 - 18:00 Sundays
Levels of illumination shall not exceed 1350nit (cd/m2) during the day and 300nit (cd/m2) after sunset and animations shall not be displayed for more than 50% of the time on any given day. 
Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the neighbourhood, in accordance with Council policy LP2 of the Local Plan coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework.
Condition : 12 - The external appearance of the development hereby permitted shall be carried out in strict accordance with the details and materials as specified in the Design and Access Statement (October 2023) by ARUP.
Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance of the building and safeguard the appearance of the area, in accordance with Council policies LP1 and LP2 coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.
Condition : 13 - Noise levels, (expressed as the equivalent continuous sound level) LAeq (15 minutes) as measured in accordance with BS4142: 2014, from any external plant/machinery shall not exceed LA90-10dB, when measured at the nearest noise sensitive receptor. Plant operating within Plot 2 shall be in accordance with the requirements set out within the hereby approved Planning Compliance Report (20/10/2023 27208.PCR.01 Rev B) by KP Acoustics.
Reason: To protect the amenities of neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policies LP1 and LP2 and LP14 of the Local Plan.
Condition : 14 - The development hereby approved shall be undertaken in accordance with the Construction Management Plan (Rev B dated 21.02.2024) by Markides Associates. Should any changes be required before or during construction works, such changes shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority pursuant to this condition. 

Reason: In the interests of traffic, general amenity of the area, neighbour amenity and biodiversity in accordance with Council policies LP50, LP51 and LP55 of the Local Plan coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework. It is necessary for the condition to be discharged prior to the commencement of any works on site to ensure the whole construction phase is in accordance with an approved plan.
Condition : 15 - Prior to the construction of any development within 5m of the water main, details of how the developer intends to divert the asset/align the development, in order to prevent the potential for damage to the subsurface potable water infrastructure, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the LPS in consultation with Thames Water. Any construction must be undertaken in accordance with the terms of the approved information. Unrestricted access must be available at all times for the maintenance and repair of the asset during and after the construction works.
Reason: The proposed works will be in close proximity to underground strategic water main, utility infrastructure. The works has the potential to impact on local underground water utility infrastructure. 
Condition : 16 - Notwithstanding the details shown on the approved plans and set out in the supporting information, a Landscape Maintenance and Management Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to the commencement of any relevant works. The Plan shall include details of all measures to provide biodiversity gain, including but not limited to: 
-	details of planting including species (including pollinator friendly plant species where appropriate);
-	details of the green wall including the type of system and species to be planted;
-	details of all biodiverse roofs (including any Biosolar roofs) including details of extensive substrate base, features to be included within the substrate e.g. rope coils, sand, gravel, etc., and details of any seeding/plug plant choice (in accordance with The Gro Green Roof Code 2021);
-	details on the management to be implemented post-construction shall also be submitted, which shall include management responsibilities and maintenance schedules for all hard and soft landscaped areas as well as the above-mentioned measures to provide biodiversity gain. 
The approved details shall be implemented prior to first occupation of the development and maintained thereafter.
Reason: To protect the biodiversity of the area in accordance with policies LP1, LP2 and LP55 of the Local Plan coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework.
Condition : 17 - Within six months of the commencement of development associated with Plot 2, or in accordance with a timetable that shall have been submitted to and been approved in writing by the local planning authority as a submission of details pursuant to this condition, a BREEAM Interim (Design Stage) Assessment issued by the Building Research Establishment (BRE) or equivalent accredited body, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority to show that a 'Very Good' with an aspiration towards 'Excellent' rating will be achieved for the Plot 2 building. The development shall be implemented in accordance with the approved rating.  
Reason: To achieve appropriate sustainability standards in accordance with Council policy LP10 of the Local Plan coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework.
Condition : 18 - Use of the development shall not commence until a community use agreement has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The submitted community use agreement shall set out (but not be limited to) measures to ensure the provision of the following:
-	Three free taster sessions (20-30mins) a week, including court hire, coaching, rackets and balls, targeted to local youth organisations.
-	Local schools invited in schooltime hours to test the sport free of charge with free coaching for two hours every week for local schools.
-	An additional 12 hours a year on top of other initiatives for the wider community, for four players with an LTA coach (tickets for charity raffles/auctions).
-	Establishment of a Youth Academy by partnering with Right to Play, an international non-profit organisation, to promote the sport and accessibility in Wandsworth. The Youth Programme would consist of LTA accredited coaches running courses for children aged 4-18.
-	An allocation of 6,000 free tickets per year for Plot 2, consisting of: 5,000 free tickets provided to local schools, and 1,000 free tickets provided to local charities, community groups and youth groups, including tickets gifted as raffle prizes for local fundraisers. 
-	Provision of an educational programme associated with Plot 2, consisting of technical and cultural educational workshops (in a 'show and tell' format) for 11 Wandsworth secondary schools and 15 Battersea primary schools, to include one session a month outside of the installation and removal programmes.
-	Work experience opportunities for school leavers and higher education students, targeting local students studying in Roehampton University and South Thames College.
-	Career panel talks with Neon staff participating in Battersea Power Station Communities Team events across a broad spectrum of career talks both culturally and technically led.
The development shall not be used otherwise than in strict compliance with the app
Condition : 19 - The landscape works and planting (including all street furniture and other minor artefacts) shown on the approved drawings shall be carried out prior to the occupation of the development, or in accordance with a programme agreed in writing with the local planning authority submitted pursuant to this condition. Should any planting die or become diseased within 5 years, this shall be replaced with a similar species/size.
Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance and to provide biodiversity interest, in accordance with Council policies LP1, LP2, LP55 and LP56 of the Wandsworth Local Plan coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework.
Condition : 20 - Prior to the first occupation of Plot 1, a post-completion light spillage report demonstrating that the 'as-built' lighting is in accordance with the lighting specifications set out in the approved drawings and documents shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. 
Reason: To protect the biodiversity of the area in accordance with policies LP1, LP2 and LP55 of the Local Plan coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework.
Condition : 21 - Prior to the first occupation of the development, the refuse and recycling storage shown on the approved drawings shall be provided and shall be retained for the users of the development and for no other purpose.
Reason: To ensure adequate provision is made for waste storage in accordance with Council policies LP1 and LP2 of the Local Plan coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework.
Condition : 22 - Prior to the first occupation of the development, a post-completion Fire Safety and Evacuation Strategy shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. Thereafter, the development shall only be carried out in accordance with these approved details.
Reason: To ensure that adequate arrangements are made for fire safety in accordance with policy D12 of the London Plan 2021.
Condition : 23 - Within three months of occupation, a post-construction circular economy monitoring report shall be completed in line with the GLA's Circular Economy Statement Guidance and shall be submitted to, and approved in writing by, the local planning authority. The development shall then be implemented in accordance with these approved details.
Reason: In the interests of sustainable waste management and in order to maximise the re-use of materials in accordance with London Plan Policy SI7 and Local Plan Policy LP13.
Condition : 24 - Within three months of occupation, a post-construction whole life-cycle carbon monitoring report shall be submitted to, and approved in writing by, the local planning authority. The development shall then be maintained in accordance with these approved details. 
Reason: In the interests of sustainable waste management and in order to maximise the re-use of materials in accordance with London Plan policy SI7 and Local Plan policy LP13.
Condition : 25 - Prior to first occupation of the development, remediation shall be completed and a verification report, produced on completion of the remediation including in situ testing of imported materials, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to occupation of any part of the development.
-	If, during development, further contamination not previously identified is found to be present at the site, the local planning authority is to be informed immediately and no further development shall be conducted until a report detailing such contamination and how it is to be remediated is submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority, and any required remediation shall be detailed and verified as an amendment to the remediation statement and accordingly conducted.
Reason: To ensure that remedial measures have been undertaken and the environmental risks have been satisfactorily managed so that the site is deemed suitable for residential use to accord with Local Plan Policy LP14 of the Local Plan coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework.
Condition : 26 - Within six months of the occupation of the Plot 2 building, or in accordance with a timetable that shall have been submitted to and been approved in writing by the local planning authority as a submission of details pursuant to this condition, a BREEAM New Construction Final (Post-Construction) Certificate, issued by the BRE (or equivalent accredited body), shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority to demonstrate that a 'Very Good' with an aspiration towards 'Excellent' rating will be achieved for the Plot 2 building. All the measures integrated shall be retained for as long as the development is in existence.
Reason: To achieve appropriate sustainability standards in accordance with Council policy LP10 of the Local Plan coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework.
Condition : 27 - INFORMATIVE: In dealing with this application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive manner and the Council has, as far as practicable, sought solutions to problems arising in relation to dealing with the planning application. The Council has made available detailed advice in the form of its statutory policies in the Local Plan (2023) as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably. In addition, where appropriate, further guidance was offered to the applicant during the processing of the application.
Condition : 28 - INFORMATIVE: The proposed development is located within 15m of Thames Waters underground assets, as such the development could cause the assets to fail if appropriate measures are not taken. Please read our guide 'working near our assets' to ensure your workings are in line with the necessary processes you need to follow if you're considering working above or near our pipes or other structures.
Condition : 29 - INFORMATIVE: The applicant is advised that their development boundary falls within a Source Protection Zone for groundwater abstraction. These zones may be at particular risk from polluting activities on or below the land surface. To prevent pollution, the Environment Agency and Thames Water (or other local water undertaker) will use a tiered, risk-based approach to regulate activities that may impact groundwater resources. The applicant is encouraged to read the Environment Agency's approach to groundwater protection.
Condition : 30 - INFORMATIVE: Flood Risk Activity Permit (FRAP) requirements
The Environmental Permitting (England and Wales) Regulations 2016 require a permit to be obtained for any activities which will take place: 
o	on or within 8 metres of a main river (16 metres if tidal) 
o	on or within 8 metres of a flood defence structure or culverted main river (16 metres if tidal) 
o	on or within 16 metres of a sea defence 
o	involving quarrying or excavation within 16 metres of any main river, flood defence (including a remote defence) or culvert 
o	in the floodplain of a main river if the activity could affect flood flow or storage and potential impacts are not controlled by a planning permission
For further guidance please visit https://www.gov.uk/guidance/flood-risk-activitiesenvironmental-permits or contact our National Customer Contact Centre on 03708 506 506. The applicant should not assume that a permit will automatically be forthcoming once planning permission has been granted, and we advise them to consult with us at the earliest opportunity.
Condition : 31 - INFORMATIVE: The applicant is advised that any external lighting should be installed as per the guidance by the Bat Conservation Trust and Institution of Lighting Professionals: https://www.theilp.org.uk/documents/guidance-note-8-bats-and-artificial-lighting/. Ecologically important dark corridors must be maintained by careful positioning and downward projection of any external lighting. Also being mindful to prevent any increased illumination of the river.

application_details.scheme_name: Battersea Power Station Phase 6 Meanwhile Uses
